name: premed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] a college or university course that prepares students for medical school: Michael decided that premed was no longer for him. I started in premed and switched to social work.
[ C ] a student who is doing a course that prepares him or her for medical school: This is a difficult question to answer for a premed.
[ C ] a drug or mix of drugs sometimes given to relax someone before an anaesthetic (= a substance that makes you unable to feel pain): The surgeon said I was nervous and gave me a premed.

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Medicines & drugs
relating to or doing a course that prepares someone for medical school: He was a premed student at the University of California. The two students had been admitted to a prestigious premed program.
More examplesFewer examplesIt all began while he was still an undergraduate on the premed track at Harvard.He offered to pay for an extra year of college if she would take premed courses.
